results.title: Oil review. No. 08
results.creator_credit: Joe Mendoza, Humphrey Swingler, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Desert tractors: contrasting these vehicles with the camel caravan in conveying refinery equipment across the desert. 2. Bottled gas: showing the value of this fuel in outlying small areas and explaining methods of delivery of supples. 3. Bunkering the “Chusan”: pumping fuel oil into the 24,000-ton ocean liner.

results.title: Oil review. No. 05
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. The Gulf run: illustrates the delivery of oil by the SS “Khuzistan” to small ports on the Persian Gulf, a four days journey. 2. Turbo prop tour: the visit to Paris of the British jet-propelled civil airliner, the “Vickers Viscount” including shots whilst in flight, refuelling and landing.

results.title: Oil review. No. 04
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Transfer by road: a story of the moving of a giant new fractionating column from the workshop in which it was made to Grangemouth Refinery, in England. 2. Something small: a story of oil helping Danish farmers to produce more eggs. 3. Made to order: new glass apparatus for the Research Station at Sunbuyry (England) is made on the premises.

results.title: Oil review. No. 02
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. The search for oil: a brief description of some of the ways in which the long search for oil is carried out. 2. Ships into pipelines: a story of breaking-up old ships and using the scrap as an ingredient for new steel for oil pipelines. 3. Comet across the sky: how the world’s first jet airliner - the de Havilland Comet - came to be made.

results.title: Oil review. No. 01
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. An introduction to “Oil Review” stressing the importance of oil in modern economy. 2. Main line diesel engine: the story of a new diesel locomotive which pulls the famous British train, “Royal Scot”, on its journey from London to Glasgow. 3. Tractor transition: the story of the advantages gained by the development of tractor design to the point where many and varied farm implements become an integral part of the tractor, instead of the tractor being merely a mechanised draught animal pulling a separate implement or machine.

results.title: Oil painting for beginners with artist Val Osborn. Number 3
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: In this third and final lesson Val Osborn begins by showing how to care for expensive sable brushes. The rest of the program is taken up by an exercise in painting a traditional still life of a wine jug, cheese, onions and grapes against a dark background. By changing the colour of the grapes from green to purple, Osborn demonstrates how colours are affected by their juxtaposition to other colours and tones. A different frame or background can also change the impact dramatically.

results.title: Oil painting for beginners with artist Val Osborn. Number 2
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: In this second lesson, artist Val Osborn introduces the concept of tone, first by showing the tonal possibilities of black and white drawings, and then by explaining colour relationships, secondary and tertiary colours, pastels and transparent colours and how to mix them on your palette. He then introduces some of the basics of landscape painting by completing two exercises; painting rocks and painting trees.
results.title_for_label: Oil painting for beginners with artist Val Osborn. Number 2
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video

results.title: Oil painting for beginners with artist Val Osborn. Number 1
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: In this, the first of three videos, the Australian artist and teacher, Val Osborn, gives a step-by step guide to basic oil-painting techniques. Beginning with a brief history of Australian art from the time of the first settlers, to illustrate the special requirements of painting the Australian landscape, he then gives an introduction to the tools of the artist. Finally he demonstrates two exercises in creating three dimensions on a flat surface, a white billiard ball on a white background and a red apple, showing how to create highlights, mid-tones, shadow and drop shadow.
